programs.show_description: From regulating the body's internal clock to possibly curing Parkinson's disease, mushrooms have been revealing one amazing ability after another!
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Explore a different side of Japan by meeting the locals and discovering traditions and cultures not usually found in guidebooks!
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Experienced anchor Del Irani has a cutting-edge dialogue with a first-class guest on current affairs topics.
This show introduces NHK World's many attractive programmes in fun short videos - the clips will also be introduced on social media to meet the needs of people who are interested in Japan.
Featured recipe: Spoon-moulded Sushi. Learn about easy, delicious, and healthy cooking with Chef Rika in five minutes!
NHK World-Japan's flagship hourly news programme delivers the latest world news, business and weather with a focus on Japan and the rest of Asia.
Traditional techniques and resourceful recipes as Chefs Saito and Rika present their unique approaches to cooking delicious Japanese food!
This programme gives you comprehensive coverage of events in Japan and Asia, explaining the day's developments and what is behind them.
An in-depth interview programme featuring professionals or experts in the world who share their unique insights, information and analysis.
Spear squid is immensely popular in squid-loving Japan - tag along with fishers in Hokkaido and savour some regional cuisine, fresh sushi, and a special take on a beloved Italian-inspired inky dish.
Airing Laundry at the Local Well: It's summer and a group of women have gathered at the local well - we learn about the different techniques and tools used to wash and dry different types of kimonos.
Dig deeper into current affairs. Cutting-edge information and critical analysis on important issues confronting Japanese lives.
This is an unusual series that explores human dramas through chance encounters with ordinary people at selected locations.

The Setagaya Line is a small but central streetcar line in Setagaya Ward - join us as we explore a 450-year-old flea market, visit a temple brimming with cats, and meet members of the community.

Wakasagi, small 10-centimetre fish, are the star of Japan's winter fishing season - drill holes in an icy lake for some line fishing and meet fishers who are passionate about conservation efforts.
